article: What Does It Mean When Your Right Ear Rings? 6 Possible Spiritual Interpretations
intro: You’ve probably experienced a high-pitched ringing or buzzing sound in your ear at some point. The cause could be

steps.title: The ear may be used to hear messages from God.
steps.subtitle: Multiple times in the book of Revelations, God says, "Whoever has ears, let them  to the churches." The "hearing" He speaks of is not literal sounds, but spiritual ones: the Holy Spirit speaks to you in messages nobody else can hear, and the messages may come in the form of words, or they may come in the form of ringing.
sub-points: This interpretation is backed up by Job 13:17, in which God says, “Listen carefully to what I say; let my words ring in your ears." If your ears are ringing, it's a sign from God to pay attention to His messages!

steps.title: You may have tinnitus.
steps.subtitle: Tinnitus is the medical term for ear-ringing, and it’s very common, especially among older people who may suffer from age-related hearing loss. You may also get tinnitus due to an ear injury or problem with the circulatory system, or just because of an earwax buildup or a foreign object lodged in your ear. Tinnitus may present as ringing, buzzing, or humming, and it may persist for a period of time, or it may come and go. Unless it interrupts your daily life, there’s usually no need to .
sub-points: In rare cases, tinnitus may be caused by an ear tumor. Ear tumors may be accompanied by neurological issues such as speech and balance problems. Ear tumors are usually benign, but if you experience any of these symptoms, see a doctor immediately.
